intro: Strombocarpa, commonly known as the sea holly, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its striking blue or purple flower heads, which resemble small, clustered umbels. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and saline soils, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Strombocarpa has feathery, aromatic leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. Its unique morphology and ecological niche make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
